review: i cant lie i cried my eyes out
was a solid story game the addition of jogging was the cherry on top

great game to the moon is the best but this one also has a good story and music just be warned this has very little game play you just walk and pick up some things the story just unfolds as you do things you can play this one then to the moon or vice versa there story is connected i give it 75 just because there is very little gameplay if i rate it for just the story and connection to to the moon its a 810 for me

this game really shook things up from what came before using both plot points and mechanics from the prior games to make something that stands out  it does a great job of shaking up the setting and leaving fans what will happen next just make sure to have played the prior games first or it wont make much sense
worst game in the series in my opinion but that doesnt mean it is bad still an incredible game 910

another amazing brainbending emotional game from freebird games  they never fail to make a masterpiece  this one is a different vibe to to the moon and finding paradise  more weird mystery than the previous entries and the twists are well theyre something else  get this game  play it  then play it again  and then play the other games in the series because theyre all some of the best games i have played
the notquiteending but still the third main game in the trilogy of one of the best series ever made

just finished i impostor factory i part of the i to the moon i series and the sequel to i finding paradise i this game continues to carry the torch of high quality writing and music set by its predecessors at first glance it doesnt appear to be a direct sequel but the story does tie into the rest of the franchise in a very satisfying way i cant wait to see what comes next

once again freebird games made me sob but i guess thats why i buy their games so kudos to them i was honestly sceptical when i read about this game having stuff related to a timeloop but it ended up being pretty fun and interesting in its own right like with their other games impostor factorys story is super touching and i love the art style definitely recommended if you like emotional story games
an absolutely fantastic addition to the to the moonfinding paradise saga my tearducts got a thorough spring cleaning
a short emotional story not as good as the previous game but still very much worth playing

knew it was gonna be absolute peak once i saw run as an option and the ending was even more peak basically binge played the other 3 before this within 2 days so id say this was a 910 experience would be 1010 if it let me admire the pictures a lot longer near the end
if youve already played the first two dont even bother waiting for a sale i wish i hadnt if you havent play them first then come back this is the best one of the series in its own different way

great game as always from this creator youll want to play this title for the story as theres not much in regards to gameplay  its been a while since i played their last games but this one feels most like a visual novel full interactive than the others up until here i remember the other ones having at the very least have some type of puzzles although i might be wrong but not this one

the series never disappoints me but i think this is the best chapter ive played yet definite recommend for fans of the original series and i hope if youre a passerby with no clue about the to the moon series if you like noveltype games please do give this a try all sorts of warm funny mysterious and touching little tales await
long cat did not protecc me from bawling my pugging eyes out

h1one of the greatest experiences in gamingh1 this game is the honestly perfect ending to the trilogy the story i expected to play did not at all come to reality instead a much better experience played out before me honestly the to the moon series might have been the coolest and most inspiring set of tales interweaving into a a narrative unseen by any other media that i have watched 1010 game everyone should play at least the original to the moon
loved the story please give me more
im not crying youre crying shut up quietly sobs

actually super immersive story i was surprised how deeply i was drawn into it from the beginning
adore this series have tissues nearby 1010
truly the perfect culmination of freebird games work following to the moon and finding paradise this game manages to feels even more polished and carefully crafted bravo
unexpectedly deep at places

another very nice story from the kao it is highly recommended to play one of the previous two games before playing this it provides some meanings to the story being told here otherwise it may seems a bit confusing if you like the first two then you will enjoy this one also

if you are reading this and havent played the earlier games in the series starting with to the moon then go and play them first if you have played those and were moved by them then this one will not let you down these games are some of the most special emotional games out there if the developers ever read this then thank you
omg i adored this
the start of the end of a great journey

this is good if you played the previous game before although kan goa is still struggling to make something better than to the moon  the presentation is interesting the story is good by its own but to be the link to the main story it can considered quite weak  ps i think i just forgot to review this game for 4 years
i dont think i will ever play a freebird game without bawling tears ricebot is a legend though

at first the game didnt convince me although the premise was interesting but as usual for freebird games i just started crying during act 2 and it happened twice more on the road to the ending it is a bit of a stretch compared to the other games of the series and i can understand why some people dont like it but it is indeed another beautiful work of art thanks really

at first impostor factory didnt resonate with me quite as strongly however it has one of the most poignant second acts in the series if youre a parent then itll definitely hit a little harder if is a layered story that needs the previous two entries in order to achieve its endgoal i will say that the pixelart and music while always strong feel very well refined here im hoping we see a continuation or possible finale at some point as things seem to be coming together
i dont even get the gist of the plot till the end i expected the thrill of horror and some pursuitbut what i got are slices of life with romancedidnt see that coming

ibut to stay as long as one wants for as long as one can stay thats the most anybody could ask of anybody elsei   that last montage really begged for laura shigiharas song still another great story another puddle of tears ps the comic book is fantastic as well
ending hits like a truck as usual

ricebot is the mastermind of this story   i tried postponing this for months because i knew it would make me cry i finally played it it made me cry a lot i kinda saw the ending coming and i love how neil got his fathers personality and his mothers brain
ow
quite a deviation from the first 2 games but its still a good story

an excellent entry into the series  relative to the prior entries im happy that theyve decided to not include the outofplace puzzle gameplay portions to focus on the writing and pacing over the past 15 years gaming this is perhaps the one dev that has yet to disappoint with their sequelsprequels
its a 2d pixel art visual novel with an amazing story freebird is an amazing storyteller
genuinely one of the best games ive ever played 100 im going to be thinking about this one forever
they dont miss

absolutely wonderful game with a very heartfelt story however if you are looking for a puzzle rpg this isnt that kind of game there is a singular puzzle in the whole game in order to truly appreciate the game just interact with everyone and enjoy the ride this series of games tells a beautifully crafted and emotional story that made me actually care about the characters
the game was short but incredibly exciting and amazing

beautiful and heartbreaking as with the rest of this series worth playing the others first as there is light continuity between them this one approaches the subject matter from a slightly different angle deepening the overall narrative while being its own story

an absolute masterpiece that smacks you then when you are already down and weeping it keeps kicking for several hours until it stops asks you to look up and tell it how it was and all you can say beautiful thank you   thank you kan gao and freebird games for yet another tearfest of a masterpiece for showing us the beauty and sadness of life through a very unique perspective i dont think could work in any other media
good game you need to play the other games before this one

its a good game i cant say much without spoiling it but i will say the mood is very engaging at several points the faq is not clear about it so i will say now that playing their other games beforehand is necessary as to why it is up to you to find out d
masterpiece  play to the moon and finding paradise first

the game is simply beautiful and completely out of the box you expect something will happen but suddenly something else happens and you just stay whaaaat there are many emotion i felt sad and happy with many things in the story but there are multiple perspectives and sides i laughed a lot with some parts i can say it was really immersive and loved this game truly

another excellent game by freebird games  this one was a bit different than their prior gamesbut it brings an interesting conclusion but probably not to the series    honestly if youve played all the other ones then you are going to be playing this one too  if you havent played the other ones yet then youre going to want to start with to the moon  if you reading this and havent played to the moon go get it  even if not on salebut it does go on sale regularly
this game is not for the faint of heart you will cry and sob

a really good story telling game however even if not needed i deeply recommend playing the other games beforehand the story was not  what i expected and it also was not the best however it was still really good and a pleasent experience that i will look back on fondly cant wait to read theories and perspectives of others now that i finished it  over all my personal rating of the game would be 75 or even 8 out of 10
its something else act 2 made me ugly cry
cry factory made me want to replay the old games
one of the most unexpected games regarding every aspect insanely underrated freebirdgames gained a huge fan

at first i struggled to get into impostor factory without my favorite characters neil and eva in the beginning i lost interest and put the game down for a while but when i finally gave it another chance wow it completely blew me away the story unfolded in such an incredible way that i was hooked until the very end i learned a lot of lessons as well you should play the entire series in order and save impostor factory for last trust me

wow theres such a leap forward with the animations and writing from the past games not to say those werent good as well but the atmosphere set during the different acts of this chapter of the freebird games is really compelling
made me cry very good installment in the series
walking sim that will absolutely make you cry

life is unfair and you dont always get what you want there is always going to be a challenge for you to overcome and a difficult challenge at that but it is all part of life and i think that is what this game wants to tell us  with a great story an incredible twist and emotional ending this game really gets you in the feels sometimes i truly think this game is amazing

what a twist of events i really enjoyed the story in this game nothing will compare to the first game in the series to the moon however this one was very fun to play through a wonderful and beautiful story yet again
not as emotional as the previous 2 games but its still an amazing story really good

starting this i was hoping it would be something new it showed signs of promise and intrigue something different something unique ambitious and daring but then act 2 comes along and the game decides to abandon its identity stops trying and goes back to the tried and true formula of the first two games  i was disappointed  its still a good game of course but it couldve been special unfortunately its just another small part of the to the moon series the way it ended up being
